description: The Japanese anemone (Anemone hupehensis var. japonica 'Pamina') has outstanding beauty and longevity. It produces delicate pink and white flowers five inches wide in fall that contrast with finely textured foliage. The foliage persists through winter creating interest in the garden. This plant grows in clumps, creating a lush effect and its petals close at night and in cold weather, creating a graceful transformation. In addition to its beauty, Japanese anemone is also exceptionally easy to care for. It is tolerant of a range of soil types and is low maintenance requiring minimal pruning. Plus, it's deer resistant and drought tolerant making it the perfect addition to any garden.
